thread.title: UPDATE 1-British fast fashion chain New Look earnings, revenue falls

author: Reuters Editorial
title: UPDATE 1-British fast fashion chain New Look earnings, revenue falls
text:
(Adds detail, Quote: )
LONDON, Feb 6 (Reuters) - British fast fashion chain New Look on Tuesday said its earnings and revenue fell in the three quarters to December as it implemented a turnaround strategy after struggling to compete in the British market.
Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation fell to 43.8 million pounds ($61 million) in the 39 weeks ending in December, from 153.8 million pounds in the same period a year earlier.
Revenue fell 6.3 percent to 1.07 billion pounds.
“As we expected, Q3 trading remained challenging, with sales and margins impacted by the high level of discounts,” Executive Chairman Alistair McGeorge said.
“Our immediate priority is to exit the current financial year without excess stock. By entering FY19 with clean stock levels we will be in a good position to deliver a strong full price Spring/Summer offer.”
New Look’s South African owner Brait SE wrote down the value of the business to zero in November until its “turnaround strategy has taken shape”, adding that it remained a committed long term shareholder.
In 2015 Brait agreed to buy a 90 percent equity stake in New Look for 780 million pounds from private equity firms Apax and Permira, giving the retailer an enterprise value of 1.9 billion pounds, which includes 1 billion pounds in debt.
Permira and Apax had held the asset for over a decade, an unusually long period for buyout funds.
New Look opened its first store in 1969 and now has 596 in the UK and 300 across Europe, China and Asia.
New Look, like the British market more broadly, has had to contend with a weaker pound, internet-focused competition, and a squeeze on consumers as inflation rises and wage growth slows.
$1 = 0.7154 pounds Reporting by Dasha Afanasieva, editing by Maiya Keidan and Jason Neely
